description: From its radical beginnings to its final fascist incarnation, Italian Futurism shocked the world, but no single work exemplified the sheer delirium of the movement than this sculpture by one of its leading lights: Umberto Boccioni.

The French-born artist’s signature work, Spider was created in the mid-1990s when Bourgeois (1911-2010) was already in her eighties. It exists in numerous versions of varying scale, including some that are monumental. Spider is meant as a tribute to the artist’s mother, a tapestry restorer.
